title: What LGBT+ music is good? - Quora

response.answer_text: The Tom Robinson Band (UK). Several very strong, take it to the street songs about gay rights: Sing if You’re Glad to be Gay, and Power in the Darkness. Holly Near (singing for peace since the Viet Nam war). Phranc (the lesbian next door, sorry I missed you at McCabes, I suggested you play there, several years ago!!)

LGBT+: Lesbian: girl in red / Melo Moreno / Hayley Kioko / Starley / Jesse & Joy / Eli Rosex.Gay: Troye Sivan / Dawn Avenue / Todrick Hall / Queen.Bisexual: Katy Perry / Ariana Grande / María Becerro / Victoria Monét / Anne-Marie.Trans: Sam Smith.Hope you like ‘em!! PS: Sam Smith used to identify as a gay man, but not anymore: now they recognise themself as non-binary.
